item.title: World Blitz Championship 2024 LIVE Updates, Day 1: Carlsen in action; Arjun, Caruana in joint-lead; Vaishali with perfect score - Sportstar
item.description:
World Blitz Championship 2024 LIVE Updates, Day 1: Carlsen in action; Arjun loses to Caruana; Vaishali continues to lead in Women’s

Publication Date: December 31, 2024

Source: Sportstar

The World Blitz Championship 2024 has kicked off in Wall Street, New York, featuring 17 Indian players, including prominent matches where Magnus Carlsen shines while Arjun Erigaisi suffers a defeat to Fabiano Caruana.

  • Magnus Carlsen has recorded multiple wins on Day 1 of the tournament.
  • Arjun Erigaisi faced a critical loss against Caruana.
  • Vaishali secured her position at the top of the Women's section.
  • Highlights include engaging matchups between top players from around the world.
“Ah, crushing. Arjun’s winning run also comes to an end after he resigns…”

This year's championship showcases some of the best chess talent globally, with significant competition anticipated in both the open and women's sections.

item.title: Australia, Umpires Labelled "Cheaters" By MCG Crowd For Yashasvi Jaiswal DRS Drama. Video Viral - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Australia Crowd Calls Umpires 'Cheaters' Over Jaiswal Dismissal Controversy

Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: NDTV

The controversy surrounding Yashasvi Jaiswal's dismissal during the Boxing Day Test has sparked widespread debate, particularly over a contentious third umpire decision that led to 'cheater' chants from the crowd.

  • Jaiswal was initially given not out on a caught-behind appeal but was overturned by the third umpire.
  • The decision was made without any spike detected on the Snicko technology.
  • India lost the match by 184 runs after a late collapse following Jaiswal's dismissal at 84 runs.
  • The incident has reignited discussions about the reliability of DRS (Decision Review System) in cricket.
  • A record crowd of 74,362 attended the match at the MCG.
The crowd is not having it. Been chanting non-stop for 10 mins now — Gaurav Kapur

This incident has raised questions about umpiring standards and the impact of technology in cricket, particularly during high-stakes matches like the Boxing Day Test.

item.title: "Third Umpire Should Have...": BCCI Top Official Breaks Silence As Yashasvi Jaiswal DRS Row Divides .. - NDTV Sports
item.description:
"Third Umpire Should Have...": BCCI Top Official Breaks Silence As Yashasvi Jaiswal DRS Row Divides Cricket World

Publication Date: December 30, 2024   Source: NDTV

BCCI vice president Rajeev Shukla criticizes the third umpire's decision regarding Yashasvi Jaiswal's dismissal during the Boxing Day Test against Australia. The row highlights discrepancies in DRS technology usage.

  • Jaiswal was dismissed on a controversial decision while batting on 84.
  • Shukla stated Jaiswal was clearly not out and that the third umpire should rely on technology.
  • Sunil Gavaskar and other cricket officials criticized the decision.
  • The dismissal led to Australia securing a 184-run victory and a 2-1 lead in the series.
“Yashaswi jayaswal was clearly not out. Third umpire should have taken note of what technology was suggesting.” — Rajeev Shukla (@ShuklaRajiv)

This incident underscores ongoing debates about DRS and umpiring decisions in cricket.

item.title: Vinod Kambli dances his way through recovery: Ex-cricketer’s hospital moves go viral - Mint
item.description:
Vinod Kambli dances his way through recovery: Ex-cricketer’s hospital moves go viral

Publication Date: December 30, 2024 Source: Live Mint

Former Indian cricketer Vinod Kambli has become a viral sensation for his joyful dance in a Thane hospital while recovering from health issues.

  • Kambli was admitted to Akruti Hospital on December 21 due to a urinary infection and muscle cramps.
  • Tests revealed brain clots, but his health is reportedly improving.
  • A video showing him dancing has gone viral, bringing smiles to staff and fans.
  • Kambli expressed gratitude on social media for the support from fans and hospital staff.
  • He is known for his remarkable cricketing career, scoring 2,477 runs in ODIs and 1,084 runs in Test matches.
“I have reached this far because of your love.” - Vinod Kambli

This uplifting moment highlights the power of positivity and support during tough times.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah Nominated For ICC 'Test Cricketer of the Year' Award - News18
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah Nominated For ICC 'Test Cricketer of the Year' Award

Date & Source: December 30, 2024, 20:35 IST, News18 Cricket

Indian vice-captain and ace fast-bowler Jasprit Bumrah is among the four nominees for the International Cricket Council (ICC) men’s ‘Test Cricketer of the Year’ Award for 2024. He’ll compete with England’s Joe Root and Harry Brook and Sri Lanka’s Kamindu Mendis for the prestigious award.

Bumrah had an exceptional 2024 in the longest format of the game. In 13 matches, he took a whopping 71 wickets — one more than his combined tally for the last four years — at an average of 14.92. He recorded as many as five five-wicket hauls in the year, including three in the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia.

  • Took 71 wickets in 13 Tests in 2024
  • Recorded five five-wicket hauls
  • Nominated alongside Joe Root, Harry Brook, and Kamindu Mendis

Bumrah started the year with spells of 2/25 and 6/61 against the Proteas at Newlands.

He’ll face stiff competition from Root, Mendis, and Brook, who also had remarkable years in Test cricket.

item.title: Indian Fans Shout 'Cheaters' As Third Umpire Overrules Snicko To Give Yashasvi Jaiswal Out | Watch - News18
item.description:
Indian Fans Shout 'Cheaters' As Third Umpire Overrules Snicko To Give Yashasvi Jaiswal Out | Watch

Date: December 30, 2024

Source: News18

The Boxing Day Test saw a controversial wicket as Yashasvi Jaiswal was adjudged out caught behind by the third umpire, overturning the on-field not-out decision, even when Snicko showed no evidence of an edge.

  • Jaiswal was on the fifth ball of the 71st over when the incident occurred.
  • The on-field umpire Joe Wilson initially ruled not out, leading to an appeal from Australia.
  • Third umpire Sharfuddoula reviewed the footage and decided to overrule, despite no conclusive Snicko evidence.
  • The crowd reacted negatively, with chants of 'cheaters' heard in the stadium.
  • Jaiswal scored 84 before his dismissal, and his wicket contributed to India’s precarious position at 140/7.
“The third umpire had enough evidence to overturn the on-field call, even though Snicko didn’t show any definitive touch.”

The incident has raised questions about the reliability of third umpire decisions and the technology used in similar situations.

item.title: 'It Is Mentally Disturbing': Rohit Sharma Dejected After India's Poor Show In Melbourne - News18
item.description:
India's Poor Show in Melbourne

Date & Source: Last Updated: December 30, 2024, 18:38 IST, News18

India's hopes of winning the Border-Gavaskar Trophy ended with a crushing defeat in the 4th Test against Australia in Melbourne. Chasing 340, India lost their top-three batsmen early, but Yashasvi Jaiswal and Rishabh Pant revived the innings. However, a batting collapse in the third session led to India's defeat by 184 runs.

India captain Rohit Sharma described the performance as "mentally disturbing" and "disappointing".

  1. India lost the Test series 2-1.
  2. Rohit Sharma expressed his disappointment and frustration.
  3. Batting collapse in the third session led to India's defeat.
  4. Jasprit Bumrah, Yashasvi Jaiswal, and Nitish Rana were the bright spots for India in the match.

"It is mentally disturbing when you can’t do what you have come to do... It is pretty disappointing. There are ways to win games and we fell short in finding ways to win the game here. We wanted to fight till the end and unfortunately, we couldn’t do it." - Rohit Sharma

Conclusion: India's defeat in Melbourne has left Rohit Sharma and the team dejected, with the captain expressing his frustration at their inability to win the game.

item.title: Vinod Kambli's iPhone taken away by shopkeeper after he fails to pay just Rs... - DNA India
item.description:
Vinod Kambli's iPhone taken away by shopkeeper after he fails to pay just Rs...

Publication Date: December 30, 2024 - Source: DNA India

Former Indian cricketer Vinod Kambli is currently facing serious health and financial challenges. Recently admitted to Akruti Hospital in Thane, he is recovering from health issues, while also struggling to pay maintenance fees that have accumulated to approximately Rs 18 lakh.

  • Kambli's iPhone was taken by a shopkeeper due to unpaid repair costs of Rs 15,000.
  • He has been hospitalized after suffering from clots in his brain.
  • Kambli relies on a BCCI pension of Rs 30,000 per month, which is insufficient to cover his expenses.
“My condition was severe at the time of admission, but medical professionals have since stabilized my health,” Kambli mentioned.

This situation highlights the extreme difficulties Kambli faces both personally and financially, underlining the importance of support for former athletes.
